title: Authors and Citation
text: Dalton YourLastName. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: YourLastName D (2026). SPQRX: SPQRX: Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression Neural Networks. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {SPQRX: SPQRX: Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression Neural Networks},   author = {Dalton YourLastName},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

what: SPQRX: Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression Neural Networks
title: SPQRX: Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression Neural Networks
text: SPQRX (Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression eXtremes) performs bulk--tail density regression using neural networks. package implements methodology paper arXiv, built around keras3 library R.

title: SPQRX: Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression Neural Networks
text: can install development version SPQRX GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("reetamm/SPQRX")

what: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
title: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
text: Internal constructor used package trained SPQR/SPQRX model together metadata required prediction explainability methods.

title: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
code: create.package.model(   model,   n.knots,   knots,   hyperparameter = NULL,   normalizer = NULL,   variable_names = NULL,   spqrx = TRUE )

title: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
text: model trained keras model object. n.knots Integer. Number spline knots. knots Numeric vector knot locations. hyperparameter Optional list containing model hyperparameters (e.g., p_a, p_b, c1, c2). normalizer list containing normalization parameters. variable_names Optional character vector covariate names. spqrx Logical. TRUE heavy-tail SPQRX model.

title: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
text: object class `"spqrx_model"`.

title: Construct an SPQRX model object — create.package.model
text: function called directly users.

title: Construct normalization metadata — create.package.normalize.list
text: Internal helper used store normalization parameters computed model fitting.

title: Construct normalization metadata — create.package.normalize.list
code: create.package.normalize.list(x_std, x_mean, y_max, y_min)

title: Construct normalization metadata — create.package.normalize.list
text: x_std Numeric vector feature standard deviations. x_mean Numeric vector feature means. y_max Maximum value response variable. y_min Minimum value response variable.

title: Construct normalization metadata — create.package.normalize.list
text: list containing normalization parameters.

title: Construct normalization metadata — create.package.normalize.list
text: function packages scaling statistics required normalize inputs rescale outputs prediction.

title: Create SPQRX hyperparameter specification — create.packages.hyperparameter
text: Constructs structured hyperparameter list use fit.spqrx(). function allows users explicitly control tail modeling training-related parameters.

title: Create SPQRX hyperparameter specification — create.packages.hyperparameter
code: create.packages.hyperparameter(   p_a = 0.9,   p_b = 0.99,   c1 = 25,   c2 = 5,   epochs = 200,   batch_size = 300,   activation = "relu" )

title: Create SPQRX hyperparameter specification — create.packages.hyperparameter
text: p_a Lower tail probability threshold. p_b Upper tail probability threshold. c1 Tail regularization parameter controlling density stability. c2 Tail penalty parameter. batch_size Mini-batch size used training.

title: Create SPQRX hyperparameter specification — create.packages.hyperparameter
text: list containing hyperparameters can passed   fit.spqrx().

title: Create SPQRX hyperparameter specification — create.packages.hyperparameter
code: hp <- create.package.hyperparameter(   p_a = 0.1,   p_b = 0.9,   c1 = 50,   c2 = 10,   batch_size = 500 ) #> Error in create.package.hyperparameter(p_a = 0.1, p_b = 0.9, c1 = 50,     c2 = 10, batch_size = 500): could not find function "create.package.hyperparameter"  model <- fit.spqrx(   input_dim = 5,   hidden_dim = c(64, 32),   n.knots = 10,   x_training = X_train,   x_validation = X_val,   y_training = y_train,   y_validation = y_val,   hyperparameter = hp ) #> Error in fit.spqrx(input_dim = 5, hidden_dim = c(64, 32), n.knots = 10,     x_training = X_train, x_validation = X_val, y_training = y_train,     y_validation = y_val, hyperparameter = hp): could not find function "fit.spqrx"

what: Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.ALE
title: Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.ALE
text: Computes first-order Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) selected covariate using fitted SPQR SPQRX model. ALE function measures average change predicted quantile feature varies across empirical intervals.

title: Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.ALE
code: eval.explain.ALE(model, x, tau = 0.5, k = NULL, knots = NULL, var.index = c(1))

title: Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.ALE
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x Matrix data frame covariates used compute ALE. tau Numeric vector quantile levels (0,1). k Integer. Number intervals used partition selected feature. NULL, determined spline structure. knots Numeric vector spline knots. NULL, extracted fitted model. var.index Integer vector specifying column index covariate ALE computed.

title: Accumulated Local Effects (ALE) for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.ALE
text: list containing: x: interval boundary points used feature. ALE: Matrix accumulated local effects. Rows correspond   feature intervals columns correspond quantile levels.

what: LIME Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.lime
title: LIME Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.lime
text: Computes local feature attributions using lime package quantile predictions fitted SPQR SPQRX model. Explanations generated standardized covariates using stored normalization parameters.

title: LIME Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.lime
code: eval.explain.lime(   model,   x_training,   x_explain,   tau = 0.5,   n_permutations = 5000,   original_output = FALSE )

title: LIME Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.lime
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x_training Matrix data frame training covariates. x_explain Matrix data frame observations explain. tau Numeric quantile level (0,1) quantile prediction. n_permutations Integer. Number permutations used lime::explain(). original_output Logical. TRUE, returns full LIME explanation object. FALSE (default), returns reshaped feature-weight table.

title: LIME Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models — eval.explain.lime
text: original_output = FALSE, data frame rows correspond explained cases columns correspond feature weights. Otherwise, full lime explanation object.

title: Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE) — eval.explain.QALE
text: Computes Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE) selected covariate using fitted SPQR SPQRX model. function evaluates changes predicted quantiles across empirical feature intervals accumulates averaged local effects.

title: Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE) — eval.explain.QALE
code: eval.explain.QALE(model, x, tau = seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1), var.index = c(1))

title: Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE) — eval.explain.QALE
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x Matrix data frame covariates. tau Numeric vector quantile levels (0,1). var.index Integer specifying column index covariate evaluate.

title: Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE) — eval.explain.QALE
text: list containing: x: Interval boundary points selected feature. ALE: Matrix accumulated local effects across quantiles.

what: Shapley Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models using shapr — eval.explain.shapr
title: Shapley Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models using shapr — eval.explain.shapr
text: Computes Shapley values SPQR SPQRX model predictions using shapr package. Supports quantile (QF), cumulative distribution (CDF), density (PDF) explanations.

title: Shapley Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models using shapr — eval.explain.shapr
code: eval.explain.shapr(   model,   x_training,   x_explain,   y_training,   y_explain,   type = "QF",   tau = 0.5,   shapley_method = "empirical",   variable_names = NULL,   original_output = FALSE )

title: Shapley Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models using shapr — eval.explain.shapr
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x_training Matrix data frame training covariates. x_explain Matrix data frame observations explain. y_training Numeric vector training responses. y_explain Numeric vector response values used CDF PDF explanations. type Character string specifying explanation target: "QF", "CDF", "PDF". tau Numeric quantile level (0,1) used type = "QF". shapley_method Character string specifying shapr estimation approach (e.g., "empirical"). variable_names Optional character vector variable names. NULL, default names assigned. original_output Logical. TRUE, returns full shapr explanation object. FALSE (default), returns data frame Shapley values.

title: Shapley Explanations for SPQR / SPQRX Models using shapr — eval.explain.shapr
text: original_output = FALSE, data frame Shapley values. Otherwise, full shapr explanation object.

what: Quantile-Based Variable Importance for SPQR / SPQRX — eval.explain.VI
title: Quantile-Based Variable Importance for SPQR / SPQRX — eval.explain.VI
text: Computes variable importance across quantile levels using Quantile Accumulated Local Effects (QALE). Importance defined standard deviation ALE function across feature intervals quantile level.

title: Quantile-Based Variable Importance for SPQR / SPQRX — eval.explain.VI
code: eval.explain.VI(model, x, tau = seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1), var.indexs = c(1, 2))

title: Quantile-Based Variable Importance for SPQR / SPQRX — eval.explain.VI
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x Matrix data frame covariates used evaluation. tau Numeric vector quantile levels (0,1). var.indexs Integer vector specifying indices variables importance computed.

title: Quantile-Based Variable Importance for SPQR / SPQRX — eval.explain.VI
text: matrix variable importance values.   Rows correspond variables columns correspond quantile levels.

title: Plot LIME Explanation Summary — eval.plot.lime
text: Generates summary plot LIME (Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations) feature contributions one observations. plot displays feature contributions x-axis features ordered mean absolute contribution y-axis. Points colored corresponding feature values.

title: Plot LIME Explanation Summary — eval.plot.lime
code: eval.plot.lime(model, x_training, x_explain, tau = 0.5)

title: Plot LIME Explanation Summary — eval.plot.lime
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x_training Matrix data frame training covariates used build LIME explainer. x_explain Matrix, data frame, numeric vector representing observation(s) explain. tau Numeric. Quantile level used prediction generating LIME explanations. Default 0.5.

title: Plot LIME Explanation Summary — eval.plot.lime
text: Invisibly returns ggplot object showing LIME   contribution summary.

what: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
text: Generates plot predicted probability density function (PDF) single observation using fitted SPQRX model. x-axis response variable y, y-axis represents predicted density. plot restricted range 1st 99th predicted quantiles better visualization.

title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
code: eval.plot.pdf(model, x0, npdf_points = 500)

title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
text: model fitted SPQRX model object returned fit_spqrx(). x0 numeric vector representing covariate values observation plot. npdf_points Integer. Number points evaluate PDF along y-axis. Default 500.

title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Produces ggplot2 plot predicted PDF observation.

title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
text: function computes predicted PDF grid y-values model's normalized output range. scales y-axis based model's predicted 1st 99th quantiles focus main density mass.

title: Plot Predicted Probability Density Function (PDF) for a Single Observation — eval.plot.pdf
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot PDF for the 102nd observation in the dataset eval.plot.pdf(model = fitted_model, x0 = x_training[102, ]) } # }

what: Exponential Q-Q Plot for SPQR / SPQRX Model — eval.plot.qexp
title: Exponential Q-Q Plot for SPQR / SPQRX Model — eval.plot.qexp
text: Produces exponential Q-Q plot using model-based CDF values. function evaluates fitted conditional distribution compares transformed probabilities theoretical exponential distribution.

title: Exponential Q-Q Plot for SPQR / SPQRX Model — eval.plot.qexp
code: eval.plot.qexp(model, x, y, pre_normalize = FALSE)

title: Exponential Q-Q Plot for SPQR / SPQRX Model — eval.plot.qexp
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x Matrix data frame covariates. y Numeric vector observed response values. pre_normalize Logical. FALSE (default), response values normalized using stored model parameters.

title: Exponential Q-Q Plot for SPQR / SPQRX Model — eval.plot.qexp
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Produces base R Q-Q plot.

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
text: function generates line plot variable effects across quantiles using Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) calculated fitted SPQRX model.

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
code: eval.plot.QVI(   model,   x,   var.indexs,   lower_quantile = 0.1,   upper_quantile = 0.9,   quantile_increment = 0.1 )

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
text: model fitted SPQRX SPQRx model object. x data frame matrix covariates used evaluation. var.indexs integer vector specifying covariates plot. lower_quantile Numeric. Lower quantile bound (default 0.1). upper_quantile Numeric. Upper quantile bound (default 0.9). quantile_increment Numeric. Step size quantiles (default 0.1).

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
text: plot displayed. object returned.

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
text: function computes Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) selected covariates visualizes using line plot. line represents covariate, x-axis corresponds quantiles (percentages).

title: Plot Quantile Variable Importance (QVI) — eval.plot.QVI
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ eval.plot.QVI(model = fitted_model, x = x_test, var.indexs = c(1,2,3)) } # }

title: Plot SHAP Values — eval.plot.shap
text: Generates summary plot SHAP values given model across features using results eval.explain.shapr().

title: Plot SHAP Values — eval.plot.shap
code: eval.plot.shap(   model,   x_training,   x_explain,   y_training,   y_explain,   tau = 0.5,   shapley_method = "empirical" )

title: Plot SHAP Values — eval.plot.shap
text: model fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(). x_training Matrix data frame used train model. x_explain Matrix data frame covariates explain. y_training Vector responses corresponding x_training. y_explain Vector responses corresponding x_explain. tau Numeric vector quantiles (default 0.5) QF predictions. shapley_method Character, SHAP approximation method (default 'empirical').

title: Plot SHAP Values — eval.plot.shap
text: Invisibly returns NULL. Produces ggplot2 plot SHAP feature contributions.

title: Fit SPQR Model — fit.spqr
text: Fits baseline SPQR (Spline-based Probabilistic Quantile Regression) model using neural network parameterization spline mixture weights.

title: Fit SPQR Model — fit.spqr
code: fit.spqr(   input_dim,   hidden_dim,   n.knots,   x_training,   x_validation,   y_training,   y_validation,   hyperparameter = NULL,   pre_normalize = FALSE,   package.it = TRUE )

title: Fit SPQR Model — fit.spqr
text: input_dim Integer. Number covariates (input features). hidden_dim Integer vector specifying hidden layer sizes. n.knots Integer. Total number spline basis functions. x_training Numeric matrix training covariates. x_validation Numeric matrix validation covariates. y_training Numeric vector matrix training responses. y_validation Numeric vector matrix validation responses. hyperparameter List created create.packages.hyperparameter() specifying training configuration (e.g., epochs, batch size). pre_normalize Logical. Included API consistency. Currently alter preprocessing behavior. package.Logical. TRUE (default), returns structured "spqrx_model" object. FALSE, returns raw keras_model.

title: Fit SPQR Model — fit.spqr
text: package.= TRUE, returns object class "spqrx_model" containing: trained keras model Spline knot locations Normalization parameters Variable names (available) Otherwise, returns trained keras_model object.

title: Fit SPQR Model — fit.spqr
text: function performs: Response rescaling unit interval Covariate standardization using combined training/validation statistics Construction spline basis integrated basis matrices Neural network training via .fit.spqr() fitted model can optionally returned packaged "spqrx_model" object containing normalization metadata spline information downstream prediction explainability. response variable internally rescaled unit interval prior spline construction. Covariates standardized using mean standard deviation computed combined training validation data.

title: Fit SPQRX Model — fit.spqrx
text: Trains Semi-Parametric Quantile Regression eXtreme modeling (SPQRX) neural network using training validation datasets. function standardizes covariates, normalizes response variable [0,1], constructs spline basis representations, fits SPQRX architecture.

title: Fit SPQRX Model — fit.spqrx
code: fit.spqrx(   input_dim,   hidden_dim,   n.knots,   x_training,   x_validation,   y_training,   y_validation,   hyperparameter = NULL,   package.it = TRUE,   pre_normalize = FALSE,   pre_train = TRUE )

title: Fit SPQRX Model — fit.spqrx
text: input_dim Integer. Number input covariates. hidden_dim Integer vector. Number hidden units network. n.knots Integer. Number spline knots. x_training Matrix data frame training covariates. x_validation Matrix data frame validation covariates. y_training Numeric vector training responses. y_validation Numeric vector validation responses. hyperparameter List. Optional hyperparameters including tail parameters (e.g., p_a, p_b, c1, c2). package.Logical. TRUE, returns packaged model object normalization knot information. pre_normalize Logical. Indicates whether prediction functions assume pre-normalized inputs. pre_train Logical. TRUE, performs pre-training heavy-tail component.

title: Fit SPQRX Model — fit.spqrx
text: fitted SPQRX model object. `package.= TRUE`, returns   packaged model including normalization parameters, knots, metadata.

what: Unified SPQR / SPQRX Model Fitting Interface — fit_spqrx
title: Unified SPQR / SPQRX Model Fitting Interface — fit_spqrx
text: High-level wrapper fitting either SPQR SPQRX model. function selects appropriate fitting routine based spqrx flag optionally performs pre-training SPQRX model.

title: Unified SPQR / SPQRX Model Fitting Interface — fit_spqrx
code: fit_spqrx(   input_dim,   hidden_dim,   n.knots,   x_training,   x_validation,   y_training,   y_validation,   hyperparameter = NULL,   package.it = TRUE,   pre_normalize = FALSE,   spqrx = TRUE,   pre_train = TRUE )

title: Unified SPQR / SPQRX Model Fitting Interface — fit_spqrx
text: input_dim Integer. Number input covariates. hidden_dim Integer vector. Hidden layer configuration. n.knots Integer. Number spline knots. x_training Matrix data frame training covariates. x_validation Matrix data frame validation covariates. y_training Numeric vector training responses. y_validation Numeric vector validation responses. hyperparameter List hyperparameters. NULL, default values generated via create.packages.hyperparameter(). package.Logical. Passed lower-level fitting routines determine whether model returned packaged object. false, passes back trained keras object. pre_normalize Logical. Indicates whether prediction functions assume pre-normalized inputs. spqrx Logical. TRUE (default), fits SPQRX model. FALSE, fits baseline SPQR model. pre_train Logical. TRUE, performs pre-training fitting SPQRX model.

title: Unified SPQR / SPQRX Model Fitting Interface — fit_spqrx
text: fitted SPQR SPQRX model object, depending   spqrx flag.

what: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
title: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
text: Internal training routine baseline SPQR (Spline-based Probabilistic Quantile Regression) model. function builds neural network architecture, compiles SPQR negative log-likelihood loss, performs supervised training using precomputed spline basis matrices.

title: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
code: in.fit.spqr(   input_dim,   hidden_dim,   n.knots,   knots,   x_training,   x_validation,   y_training,   y_validation,   m_basis_training,   m_basis_validation,   i_basis_training,   i_basis_validation,   hyperparameter = NULL )

title: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
text: input_dim Integer. Number covariates (input features). hidden_dim Integer vector. Number units hidden layer. n.knots Integer. Total number spline basis functions. knots Numeric vector spline knot locations. x_training Numeric matrix training covariates. x_validation Numeric matrix validation covariates. y_training Numeric vector matrix training responses. y_validation Numeric vector matrix validation responses. m_basis_training Numeric matrix spline basis evaluations training responses. m_basis_validation Numeric matrix spline basis evaluations validation responses. i_basis_training Numeric matrix integrated spline basis evaluations training responses. i_basis_validation Numeric matrix integrated spline basis evaluations validation responses. hyperparameter List. Model training configuration created create.packages.hyperparameter(), containing elements `epochs`, `batch_size`, `activation`.

title: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
text: trained keras_model object corresponding   fitted SPQR architecture.

title: Fit Base SPQR Neural Network (Internal Training Routine) — in.fit.spqr
text: function assumes : Covariates responses already preprocessed. Spline basis matrices (`m_basis_*`, `i_basis_*`)         already constructed. Hyperparameters supplied via structured list. intended called directly end users. model trained using nloglik_loss_SPQR loss function Adam optimizer. Early stopping applied based validation loss, best-performing weights saved training.

title: Internal SPQRX Training Routine — in.fit.spqrx
text: Internal function used fit.spqrx() train SPQRX model. Handles optional pre-training spline component followed heavy-tail (GPD) optimization.

title: Internal SPQRX Training Routine — in.fit.spqrx
code: in.fit.spqrx(   input_dim,   hidden_dim,   n.knots,   knots,   x_training,   x_validation,   y_training,   y_validation,   m_basis_training,   m_basis_validation,   i_basis_training,   i_basis_validation,   y.seq,   F.basis.seq,   f.basis.seq,   hyperparameter,   pre_train = TRUE )

title: Internal SPQRX Training Routine — in.fit.spqrx
text: input_dim Integer. Number input covariates. hidden_dim Integer vector. Hidden layer configuration. n.knots Integer. Number spline knots. knots Numeric vector spline knot locations. x_training Matrix training covariates. x_validation Matrix validation covariates. y_training Numeric vector training responses (normalized). y_validation Numeric vector validation responses (normalized). m_basis_training Matrix spline basis evaluations training data. m_basis_validation Matrix spline basis evaluations validation data. i_basis_training Matrix integrated spline basis evaluations (training). i_basis_validation Matrix integrated spline basis evaluations (validation). y.seq Tensor sequence [0,1] used density quantile computation. F.basis.seq Tensor integrated spline basis evaluated y.seq. f.basis.seq Tensor spline basis evaluated y.seq. hyperparameter List containing training configuration tail parameters (e.g., epochs, batch_size, activation, p_a, p_b, c1, c2). pre_train Logical. TRUE, performs initial SPQR pre-training heavy-tail optimization.

title: Internal SPQRX Training Routine — in.fit.spqrx
text: trained keras model object representing SPQRX model.

what: Predict from SPQR / SPQRX Model — predict_spqrx
title: Predict from SPQR / SPQRX Model — predict_spqrx
text: Generates predictions fitted SPQR SPQRX model object. Supports cumulative distribution (CDF), probability density (PDF), quantile function (QF) evaluation.

title: Predict from SPQR / SPQRX Model — predict_spqrx
code: predict_spqrx(   object,   x,   y = NULL,   type = "QF",   tau = 0.5,   normalize_input = FALSE,   normalize_output = TRUE )

title: Predict from SPQR / SPQRX Model — predict_spqrx
text: object fitted model object returned fit_spqrx(), fit.spqrx(), fit.spqr(). x Matrix data frame covariates prediction. y Optional numeric vector response values. Required type = "CDF" type = "PDF". type Character string specifying prediction type: "QF" (quantile function), "CDF", "PDF". tau Numeric value vector quantile levels (0,1). Used type = "QF". normalize_input Logical. FALSE (default), covariates response values normalized using stored model parameters. normalize_output Logical. TRUE (default), quantile predictions transformed back original response scale.

title: Predict from SPQR / SPQRX Model — predict_spqrx
text: type = "QF": Matrix predicted quantiles. type = "CDF": Matrix vector cumulative probabilities. type = "PDF": Matrix vector density values.

what: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
title: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
text: Splits data training, validation, testing sets optionally applies normalization predictors response.

title: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
code: preprocessing.data(   x,   y,   n.knots,   testing_ratio = 0.1,   valid_ratio = 0.1,   normalize = FALSE )

title: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
text: x Numeric matrix covariates. y Numeric vector matrix response values. n.knots Integer. Number spline knots. testing_ratio Proportion data allocated testing. valid_ratio Proportion training data allocated validation. normalize Logical. TRUE, standardizes predictors rescales response.

title: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
text: list containing: Training, validation, testing splits Spline knot locations Normalization metadata (applicable)

title: Preprocess data for SPQR/SPQRX modeling — preprocessing.data
text: normalization enabled, predictors standardized using training-set statistics, response rescaled unit interval.

what: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
title: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
text: Constructs Keras model architecture heavy-tail SPQRX (Spline-based Probabilistic Quantile Regression) model.

title: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
code: SPQRX(input_dim, hidden_dim, k, activation = "relu")

title: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
text: input_dim Integer. Dimension covariate input. hidden_dim Integer vector. Number units hidden layer. k Integer. Number spline basis functions. activation Provide activation function hidden layers.

title: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
text: keras_model object representing SPQRX architecture.

title: Build SPQRX Neural Network Architecture — SPQRX
text: network maps covariates spline mixture probabilities tail parameter \(\xi\). model output concatenates: Mixture probabilities spline basis functions Tail parameter \(\xi\) Observed response values Spline basis evaluations function defines network architecture. Model compilation, training, loss specification handled separately.

what: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
title: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
text: Internal activation function used SPQRX neural network architecture constrain xi parameter interval (0, 0.5).

title: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
code: xi_custom_activation(x)

title: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
text: x tensor input previous neural network layer.

title: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
text: tensor values constrained (0, 0.5).

title: Custom activation function for SPQRX xi parameter — xi_custom_activation
text: function applies sigmoid transformation rescales output 0.5. zeta parameter.
